attributes.action: Stop the Government ripoff on car road tax transfer return to old system
attributes.background: when a car is sold in the middle of the month the owner losses two weeks road tax refund and the new owner has to pay from the beginning of the month  paying for two weeks he/she has not had,so the GOV.is stealing four weeks road tax, return to the old system where the road tax can stay with the car

attributes.action: Make the use of parent and child parking spaces in car parks badge holders only!
attributes.background: When parking with young children in car parks extra door space is needed. Most car parks provide this facility but unfortunately some people don't think they need to have children in the car to use these spaces. I think the introduction of a badge system to use these spaces is needed to stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Every time I use or try to use these spaces that are provided for parents with children I see others use them with no children in the car. I think that this lack of consideration is very infuriating and every parent I have spoken to agrees. At one time or another I'm sure like me you have struggled to get your children out of a small space because maybe that last space had been taken by someone who didn't actually need it. If you agree with me please sign this petition

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than Â£60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: Make it law that all bus companies must have space for 2 wheelchairs and a Pram
attributes.background:
Were asking that we catch up with mainland europe when it comes to disability access especially on transport such as buses who currently only allow one wheelchair and a pram.

Disabled people travel together and to expect them to catch separate buses so they can go out together is disgraceful!
attributes.additional_details:
Its time we caught up with mainland europes public transport giving a minimum of 2 priority wheelchair spaces on each bus and a space for 1 or 2 prams.

Wheelchair users find it hard to use public transport but if your a wheelchair user with another friend whos a wheelchair user you find it impossible to go out together as you have to take separate buses some which could be an hour apart.

Its time the companies providing the service were made to make this a requirement making it fairer for all

attributes.action: Allow MOD personnel to cook meals within SLA using issued or personal appliances
attributes.background: Safety regulations have resulted in the banning of any cooking appliances other than microwave and toaster within SLA. This makes PAYD the only option on camps for eating a hot meal, allowing for monopoly by contractors. Personnel should be allowed the option of cooking their own meals if they wish.

attributes.action: Reduce the working day to 6 hours with the same salary.
attributes.background:
Companies in Sweden have reduced the working hours of their employees to six hours, reporting happier staff, a lower turnover rate, and an increase in profits in that time.

Who doesn't want to spend more time with their friends and family, whilst also being more motivated and productive at work?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/sweden-introduces-six-hour-work-day-a6674646.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/the-six-hour-work-day-increases-productivity-so-will-britain-and-america-adopt-one-sweden-a7066961.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-34677949

attributes.action: Drug test all ministers and senior civil servants including the military
attributes.background: Rig workers are tested to avoid destroying the North Sea in fact lots of employers demand a pre employment tests. Our representatives are running the country and far too many senior politicians behave and look like they are on much more than fairy dust .We deserve the best.

attributes.action: Reduce the full time working week to 35 hours, without lowering current salary.
attributes.background:
The UK Government needs to tackle the long-hours culture & promote a restructuring of working time (max 35 hours per week) and the way in which people work such as flexible working.

People who work more than 48 hours per week report more problems in terms of work & health than those who do not.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the 2011 Workplace Employment Relations Study (WERS), 41% of employees agreed or strongly agreed with the statement: âPeople in this workplace who want to progress usually have to put in long hours.â 

According to the Fifth European Working Conditions Survey, people who work more than 48 hours per week report more problems in terms of work and health than those who do not.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of tobacco products in the UK
attributes.background: Tobacco products such as cigarettes kill 100,000 people around the  the UK in one year. It also harms many other people through second hand smoking. The life expectancy of a smoker is about 10 years less than a non smoker. Wouldn't it save many more lives if you banned the sale of tobacco products?
attributes.additional_details: http://patient.info/health/smoking-the-facts

attributes.action: Stop Sexual Harrassment in Schools
attributes.background:
A 2010 YouGov poll of 16-18 year olds found 29% of girls experienced unwanted sexual touching at school and a further 71% said they heard sexual name-calling towards girls at school daily or a few times per week.
We want it to be made law for schools to train teachers on how to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
Data published in September 2015 showed that 5,500 sexual offences were recorded in UK schools over a three year period, including 600 rapes. 
In 2015 Girlguiding UK found 90% of young women aged 13-21 agree that the government should make sure all schools are addressing sexual harassment and bullying in schools.

attributes.action: Limit maximum private parking charges.
attributes.background: This petition is to get a law in place to limit the maximum fine private parking companies can charge to Â£60 and a minimum of a 50% discount if paid within 14 days.

attributes.action: Close legal loophole allowing NHS Price cap rules to be bypassed. Criminalise it
attributes.background: Several unscrupulous companies have made millions by legally bypassing the NHS price cap rules, by dropping the brand names of medicines and giving them their generic name.  This has caused astronomical price hikes, and patients are being refused their medicines because the NHS cannot afford them.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3623324/Millionaire-firms-forcing-price-common-NHS-drugs-262MILLION-year-exploiting-branding-loophole.html

attributes.action: Force advertisers to label manipulated images and provide link to original media
attributes.background: Our children and young adults are surrounded by media portraying unnatural and mostly unattainable body images. In many cases that media has been considerably digitally manipulated (eg, airbrushing) and I propose legislation for such images to include a link to the original unenhanced image.
attributes.additional_details: Many studies and reports show the negative effect on our younger generation of being constantly subjected to images of such extreme and artificial body images. By forcing the producers of such media to include a link to the original image (by way of, say, a reference number or QR code or similar) the media would be more transparent to such harmful image manipulation.

attributes.action: Change the 40 year rolling exemption for classic vehicles to 30 year.
attributes.background: I feel that the standard should be revised from 40 years to 30 years. Many cars over 25 years now are classic cars and are on classic car policys which do little mileage per year. Cars over 20 years are rarely seen on the road on a daily basis so I think the above should be revised.
attributes.additional_details: My vehicle is a classic car and is 26 years old. It is on classic car insurance as there are only 30 of my vehicle on the road and is classed as a classic vehicle by my insurer so why shouldn't I get historic car status in 4 years time.

attributes.action: Make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.background: Im a food lover and blogger and I want to make a change. I have loved food ever since I watched a Jamie Oliver christmas special back in 2006. My love for food and specifically helping younger people have grown over the years and now I want to kick up a fuss and make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.additional_details: The number of children taking Food Technology at GCSE is dropping. Too many kids nowadays are growing up not knowing how about food, with around 2 million children growing up with just one parent-it is questionable that mums and dads just don't have the time to teach their children how to cook/bake. The Department of Education quite clearly is TOO focused on wanting the children of the future to grow up to become more academic.

attributes.action: Restore the Imperial system of measurment to the UK and phase out Metrication.
attributes.background: Metrication was forced upon the UK as a result of joining the so called EEC with those that resisted being prosecuted. Now that we are about to become a sovereign nation again and resume trade with many commonwealth and former colonies we need to return to what is a superior standard of measurement.

attributes.action: The UK to leave the EU Single Market by the end of 2016
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM government to respect the democratic will of the people and as such, make immediate arrangements for the UK to completely withdraw from the EU Single Market by no later than the end of 2016.

attributes.action: Relax the rules on appearance to allow service personnel to blend in more.
attributes.background: After recent attempted kidnapping of a serviceman I think it's time that the rules governing appearance and grooming should be permanently relaxed to allow serviceman appear to be a member of public.

attributes.action: Incentivise businesses to increase the number of Standing Desks for employees
attributes.background: Employees spend 40+ hours a week at their desks, the lack of movement is a key problem in the obesity pandemic. Introducing standing desks DRAMATICALLY reduces this and the chances of type II diabetes. Getting businesses to bring in standing desks will help make Britain healthier. We need guidelines
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the benefits of standing desks have been ratified by research conducted in the States and in Britain. According to the researchers 'Sitting is the new smoking'. 

Below are some articles which list the benefits:

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/five-health-benefits-standing-desks-180950259/?no-ist
https://authoritynutrition.com/7-benefits-of-a-standing-desk

attributes.action: Invest more funds into research, management & recovery of CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue
attributes.background: After being diagnosed with CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue Syndrome in 2013, I've struggled to get any ongoing support for my symptoms, management and recovery. There's simply not enough understood about the condition within the NHS or the general public. More research and media exposion is urgently needed!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.meassociation.org.uk

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/how-you-can-help/introduction-to-our-cbt-get-and-pacing-report/

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/research2015/cfsme-research-collaborative/

https://www.actionforme.org.uk

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/ifp/chapter/Managing-CFSME

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/evidence/full-guideline-196524109

attributes.action: To force all large retail outlets to buy British produce first at a fair price
attributes.background: With more and more produce available in the UK, why do we need to import 100's of tons of fruit and veg. I don't mind buying wonky carrots or odd shape veg, as long as it supports our farming/fishing industry. We need to support our own producers first.

attributes.action: Harsher punishments for people who discriminate.
attributes.background: Hate crime is on the rise. There was 4,345 cases of homophobic hate crime in 2011/12 and there was 5,597 cases in 2014/15. These criminals only get a fine or a short prison sentence for their crimes, this has to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: I know myself what it is like to be discriminated and disrespected, its an awful feeling and makes you question yourself and your existence.

attributes.action: We demand a response to the killing of African Americans by the U.S police.
attributes.background: Following the murders of Philando Castile and Alton Sterling, we demand an official response from Her Majestyâs Government in parliament and international pressure on the US Government, the US Congress and the US Department of Justice to reform its gun laws and police use of deadly force.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the years, investigations into the high profile police killings of the following victims have yielded no police convictions:
Mike Brown (unarmed, shot whilst complying with police orders)
Tamir Rice (12 year old shot without question for holding a toy gun)
Eric Garner (unarmed, choked to death)
Rekia Boyd (unarmed girl, shot without warning in the head)
Amadou Diallo (unarmed, shot 41 times)
Sean Bell (unarmed, shot 50 times on his wedding day)
Kimani Gray
Freddie Gray

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs overtaking restrict to inside lane only motorways dual carriageways
attributes.background: Lorries that overtake can sometimes take 2-5 miles to do so and should all be restricted to roughly the same maximum speed, I Believe that all HGVs should be banned from overtaking and be restricted to use if the inside lane only (except if Turing right dual carriageways )
attributes.additional_details: I'm sure we have all spent miles behind a lorry creeping past another whilst blocking a huge queue of cars and vehicles who are clearly faster moving only for the lorry to after an age pull back in front of the other lorry it's absolutely pointless and dangerous and costs money in water time for others and builds anger and frustration in all concerned

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to prescribe paracetamol
attributes.background: In 2015 over 22 million prescriptions for paracetamol were written at a cost to tax payers of over Â£80 million pounds â an average cost of Â£3.67 per prescription.....paracetamol can be purchased for 19p!!!!!

attributes.action: Abolish university fees: we should be entitled to free education.
attributes.background: Fees for attending university in England have rocketed. Now the government has announced that student maintenance grants will be replaced with loans in 2016, meaning that students could end up in up to Â£50,000 in debt.

attributes.action: Scrap the compulsory roll out of Smart Meters by energy companies
attributes.background: Smart meters said to give total control of energy use & reduce bills is a ruse to introduce âtime of dayâ pricing tariffs. Designated peak times will impact low income, pensioners and increase bills. Energy companies will manipulate behaviour to their advantage with smart meters to spy on us.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Gov has done little to stop consumer exploitation. Smart meters infringe privacy & give risk of data security. Hackers could hijack the grid & cut off your supply.  Many EU countries reject smart meters. We don't need to comply with EU Directives for compulsory smart meters.   

UK Gov must scrap compulsory roll out â itâs costly, unlikely to change consumption habits, adversely affect low income/pensioners, is invasive & a security risk, restricting freedom to use energy when you need to.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading laws.
attributes.background: Scotland has abolished them, so why can't we!

attributes.action: Make vet check-ups and treatments free.
attributes.background: Many poor families have pets, and if that pet gets into a fight, they might not have the money to pay for treatment.

attributes.action: A public enquiry to review why people voted as they did in the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
It too easy for politicians just to say referendum complete, democracy has been served. Public opinion must be present throughout the whole process, to ensure we receive a democratic outcome. 

This is a massive decision in the country's history we should find out the facts before we progress.
attributes.additional_details:
UK decision makers must be armed with infomation which details the reasons why the UK electorate voted as they did. Enabling these decision makers to formulate the next steps in a way which is in line with public opinion.

Lies have been told on both sides.

People seem to have been unaware of possible economic consequences.

Decisions have been revaluated.

Votes may have been cast as a protest against the UK government.

attributes.action: Amend MP's Oath to include a commitment to Nolan's 7 principles of public life
attributes.background: Nolan's 7 principles of public life (selflessness, integrity, objectivity, accountability, openness, honesty & leadership) are in Ministerial Code as a conduct guide, but should be made key and an explicit commitment for MPs.  The Oath MP's swear should include a promise to uphold the principles.
attributes.additional_details: Nolan's 7 principles of public life: www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-7-principles-of-public-life

attributes.action: A general election to be held when the Prime Minister David Cameron steps down.
attributes.background: This petition is to demand that a general election be held when the Prime Minister David Cameron steps down as Prime Minister. It is not right that a different Conservative candidate be given this position of power without winning a general election.
attributes.additional_details: It is only fair to the people of the United Kingdom that we be allowed a general election to elect our new Prime Minister when Mr Cameron officially leaves his post.

attributes.action: Theresa May must apologise for policies developed while Home Secretary
attributes.background: She should apologise to thousands of wrongfully deported students. She should apologise to non-EU spouses who had to leave the UK because their partner earned under Â£18,600. She should apologise to Tier 2 skilled workers being forced to leave the UK for earning under Â£35k, and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
She has refused to release court records that prove the students were wrongfully deported. She refused to prosecute high-profile journalists accused of phone hacking, one of which worked for the Government. She tried to ban WhatsApp.

She introduced laws that mean 36% of migrant primary teachers and 9% of migrant senior school teachers will be forced to leave the UK, due to the Tier 2 settlement threshold of Â£35k.

She opposes the Equality Act 2010. She has argued against the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: Set the voting age for referendums to 16
attributes.background:
Referendums cover issues with a long term effect. 

Very often a 16 year old at voting time will be 18 when the decision comes into force
attributes.additional_details:
In Scotland the voting age for many elections is already 16.

It is not logical to deprive these people of the vote for referendums.

A next step should be to make the voting age for referendums 16 throughout the UK

attributes.action: Review how MPs are elected, can exercise power & standards they must adhere to.
attributes.background:
We seek government through consensus, with resources used to achieve our priorities: 
Access to healthcare & education based on need, not ability to pay.
Mental and physical health have equal status
Economic profitability is only a tool to facilitate the achievement of these priorities.
attributes.additional_details:
MPs shall: 
-live and work in the constituency they represent
-use publicly available local education and health services.
-not receive any direct or indirect financial benefit other than their salary as an MP.
-not hold any office in any organisation during their tenure as MP, whether voluntary or paid.
-MPs income from investments, business or other interests shall be accumulated in a zero interest account. 
-not exercise any voting rights or other powers they may have over such funds.

attributes.action: Make the work-coaches at the DWP Jobcentre Plus work on commission.
attributes.background: I want them to go on commission-only because they don't really help jobseekers to get work... And by that they will only get paid if they find work to a customer and that job is suitable (skills wise) for the customer.

attributes.action: Referendum on income tax
attributes.background:
Holding a referendum has proven to be an effective and democratic way to decide the nation's future in matters of highest importance.
We therefore propose to hold a referendum to decide to abolish the income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 the tax payers have paid a weekly amount of Â£3.1billion in
income tax across all bands. We propose to abolish such mandatory
payment to the state, and instead to take back control of this money
and fund the NHS with an additional Â£3.1billion per week.
In order to comply with the rules of democracy we suggest that no less than the majority (i.e. 23,299,988 people) of eligible voters must be in favour. We can entrust the voters to make the right decision for
the Country.

attributes.action: Cross-party statement condemning hate crimes & a debate on firmer punishments
attributes.background: Since the referendum people have been using the result as an opportunity to express racism and hate. This is to ask all political parties and politicians to come together on a joint statement to stand united against racism and hate. Also to ask for a debate on firmer punishments for hate crimes.
attributes.additional_details: This is NOT about how people voted. It's about it being used as an excuse.

attributes.action: Give the 28% of people who did not vote in the UK EU referendum a chance to vote
attributes.background: In the referendum only 72% of people voted for what to happen to the country, we believe that these people who might not have understood the circumstances should have the right to vote now. We are not asking for another referendum but for a continuation of the previous vote, for the 28% undecided.
attributes.additional_details: The votes should be added on to the original totals and interpreted in the decision of whether to leave or stay in the European Union for the sake of the people of the United kingdom. We think this because the more information has been released after the original vote had taken place, and this information could alter the opinions of the undecided UK residents.

attributes.action: Referendum on the Danish option for UK devolved regions to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
Mainland Denmark is in the EU, whilst devolved Greenland and Faroe Islands are in Danemark but not in the EU.

We request that the regions that voted RemaIN, should  remain part of the EU, and the regions that voted leave, to be outside the EU, without breaking up the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
We hereby call on the elected representatives of all the areas that voted RemaIN to negotiate with the EU to enable our clearly expressed wishes to remain EU citizens, and to press the UK government to explore all possible options in our relationship with the EU.

We request that the UK government hold a new referendum on all realistic possible options for the relationship between the UK and the EU, before the UK government starts the formal process for the UK to leave the EU.

attributes.action: Introduce a complaints commission that holds the UK press truly accountable
attributes.background: We petition to replace IPSO with a regulator that actually holds the UK press to account (similar to ofcom), and take measures such as not allowing a complete bias, active investigation of misleading headlines and apologies on the same scale as the original article. Regulation should be mandatory.
attributes.additional_details: The recent referendum campaign was an example of the how toxic the UK press have become and how well they are misinforming the UK public for ulterior motives. The fact that Rupert Murdoch can use the UK press to the to fulfill his own anti-EU agenda and at the same time maintain a friendship with our prime minister shows just how corrupt the whole system is.  To abide with IPSO is not even mandatory, and the more impartial press outlets refuse to be part of it out of protest of its uselessness.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK's policy on the EU with options for different plans.
attributes.background:
A referendum not grouping policies on what we should do about the EU so the decision isn't made without asking the people.

Suggested options -

Remain in the EU
Leave but remain in the EEA
Leave the EU & EEA, keeping trade agreements 
Leave all EU agreements
attributes.additional_details:
After the July referendum MPs are now discussing what we should do and when we should do it. 

This is because the options weren't clear enough and it is in the interests of democracy to ask the population how they want to deal with Europe with regards to the key issues of membership, economy, trade and immigration.

In short, as we currently have no public consensus on a plan, we are currently set to have a new Prime Minister elected only by Tory Party members choose what we do.

attributes.action: Block all suspected and convicted terrorists and murderers from entering the UK
attributes.background: Block all suspected and convicted terrorists and murderers from entering the UK, regardless of nationality.

attributes.action: HM Government to initiate talks to allow Scotland to remain in the E.U.
attributes.background: Greenland exited the E.U. (E.E.C) in 1985, while Denmark remained within the EU. On that basis, as it's the will of the Scottish people (via the Referendum of 23/06/16) to remain within the E.U,  both Holyrood and Westminster to discuss arrangements that will Scotland alone to remain in the E.U.
attributes.additional_details: Reference to the UK referendum of 23/06/16 confirms it is the will of the Scottish people to remain within the European Union. Scotland does not agree with England and Wales and is being dragged, against its sovereign will out of the European Union.

attributes.action: Delay submission of intent to leave the EU (Article 50) until there is a new PM
attributes.background: Following the result of the referendum to leave the EU & the subsequent resignation of the PM it would not be in the UK's best interests to rush the submission of our intention to leave until a new leadership is in place.  This must be delayed until at least October to maximise the two year period.
attributes.additional_details: There are reports of EU leaders and other member states wanting the UK to submit the intention to leave immediately and begin the two year notice / negotiation period.  Given the likely duration of a leadership contest and the current target of October 2016 this could result in a rushed process and damage the chances of getting the best possible exit for the UK.  This petition is to delay the submission until a new PM and cabinet are in place so they are able to negotiate without distraction.

attributes.action: Hold a second Brexit referendum in 2 years so that more young voters have a say.
attributes.background: Article 50 means that we do not formally leave the EU for at least two years. During this time a large number of 16-17 year olds will become eligible to vote. The government will not lower the voting age, but we should allow eligible youngsters to decide either way on their future.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should also consider working with the youth parliament and implementing a way of allowing them to have a say on their future.

attributes.action: All political parties to have equal say in negotiating terms of exit from the EU
attributes.background: The future of Britain after the Referendum is the single most important issue facing us today. Our prosperity, security and well-being, as well as that of the rest of Europe and beyond is too big a responsibility for one group of politicians and cannot be left solely to the current government.
attributes.additional_details: We are told that exit negotiations could take up to two years. Mr Cameron says it should be left until his successor is appointed after October 2016. This could mean that the earliest date for implementation would be October 2018; only 15 months before the next general election which may provide a change of government. Therefore the crucial first years after implementation should involve all parties.

attributes.action: British People who are EU nationals should allowed to vote for Parl. Elections.
attributes.background: All British People should be given an opportunity to vote and stand for parliamentary Elections, just as 53 Commonwealth citizens and Irish Nationals domicile in the UK can. Should a 2nd EU Referendum be invoked all the 27 EU Citizens domicile in the UK should be allowed to vote like Irish nationals
attributes.additional_details:
The rules for the Irish were framed during the last century.
All EU nationals resident in Great Britain can vote for all other elections in the UK.
These EU nationals resident in the UK were not given a right to vote even though they pay taxes. Some of them for decades.

attributes.action: Set up a unity commission to negotiate the terms of Brexit.
attributes.background: Exceptional circumstances require an exceptional response. HM Government should set aside narrow party politics and set up a commission with the power to negotiate the terms of our exit. This must include representatives of all parties, all regions, all backgrounds, and many interest groups.
attributes.additional_details: The terms of Brexit are too important to leave to the interests of a narrow political group. A commission should be set up with the power to negotiate our exit. This would allow the nation to draw together politicians from all parties who polled more than 5% at the last general election. Members should also be appointed from business, education, unions, the law, charities, public services, security and the economy. The negotiated terms will be legally binding on the government of the day.

attributes.action: Debate the legality of denying EU migrants the vote in the EU Ref.
attributes.background: Denying EU migrants, on the electoral roll, the right to vote in the EU referendum contravenes EU law (enshrined in the TFEU, Part 2) on non-discrimination based on nationality.
attributes.additional_details: The outcome of the EU referendum has an impact on the lives of non-British nationals resident in the UK. It will also impact on the lives of their families and children. Consequently they should have the right to vote.
